meanings.definition: Extend or prolong (a session of a legislative body)
meanings.sent1: The government prorogated the parliament session to allow for further discussions.
meanings.sent2: The decision to prorogate the meeting was made to accommodate all members' schedules.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected power outage prorogated the council session, much to everyone's annoyance.
meanings.sent4: The debate prorogated into the night, with neither side willing to back down.
meanings.sent5: The speaker's gavel echoed through the chamber as he prorogated the assembly.

meanings.definition: Postpone or defer (an action or event)
meanings.sent1: I had to prorogate my dentist appointment due to a sudden work emergency.
meanings.sent2: The outdoor event was prorogated to the following weekend because of bad weather.
meanings.sent3: She decided to prorogate her study session to binge-watch her favorite show.
meanings.sent4: The team captain prorogated the match to give injured players more time to recover.
meanings.sent5: The teacher had to prorogate the test to the next day due to technical issues.

meanings.definition: Continue or carry on (a practice or tradition)
meanings.sent1: The family prorogated the tradition of baking cookies together every Christmas.
meanings.sent2: Despite the challenges, the community prorogated the annual charity event.
meanings.sent3: The school prorogated the tradition of a talent show to showcase student skills.
meanings.sent4: The company prorogated the practice of recognizing outstanding employees every month.
meanings.sent5: The club prorogated the tradition of planting a tree for every new member.
